thread.title: Local roundup: Lyman Memorial clinches ECC Small volleyball title
thread.title_full: Local roundup: Lyman Memorial clinches ECC Small volleyball title

author: The Bulletin
title: Local roundup: Lyman Memorial clinches ECC Small volleyball title
text: Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 9:41 PM Updated at 9:41 PM By The Bulletin Posted Oct. 19, 2015 at 9:41 PM WILLIMANTIC — Katy Konow totaled 23 assists and eight aces and Lyman Memorial clinched its fifth straight Eastern Connecticut Conference Small Division volleyball title on Monday night with a 25-15, 25-7, 25-11, win over the Whippets. Kristina Olenick and Andee Bender had eight and seven kills, respectively, for Lyman (15-1, 7-0 ECC Small), which has won 15 straight matches. Brianna Mundo had eight digs for Windham (4-12, 1-6). Waterford 3 Killingly 0 KILLINGLY — Vanessa Kobyluck dished out 33 assists to lead the Lancers to a sweep of the Redgals, 25-20, 25-17, 25-16, for their fourth consecutive victory. Mickayla Shelburn added 14 kills and 16 digs for Waterford (12-4, 7-0 ECC Medium). Christina McDermott had 12 digs and 11 assists for Killingly (9-7, 3-3) East Lyme 3 NFA 1 EAST LYME — Maggy Powers had a match-high 20 kills and the Vikings won three straight after dropping the first set to down the Wildcats, 23-25, 25-23, 25-23, 29-27. Alexis Bell led East Lyme (10-3, 5-2) with 38 assists. Mackenzie Burke had 15 digs and 13 kills and Isis Deloatch added eight kills and five blocks for NFA (7-7, 2-4). Fitch 3 Woodstock 1 GROTON — Mae Sefransky distributed 37 assists to lead the Falcons over the Centaurs, 25-18, 26-24, 21-25, 29-27. Jen Severino added 17 kills and 11 digs for Fitch (15-1, 7-0 ECC Large). Jacqueline Low had 20 kills for Woodstock Academy (12-5, 3-4). Griswold 3 Plainfield 1 JEWETT CITY — Skylar Hanley doled out 24 assists along with seven digs and two kills to lead the Wolverines over the Panthers, 25-17, 21-25, 27-25, 25-15. Adine Hilbert had 17 kills, six digs and four blocks and Cadey McCormack added 34 digs for Griswold (8-7, 4-2 ECC Small). Jamie Beauregard had 24 digs for Plainfield (10-6, 3-3). Ledyard 3 New London 1 LEDYARD — Julianna Duben had seven aces and the Colonels earned a win in the ECC Medium, 25-12, 13-25, 25-19, 25-17. Ahna Harkness had 12 assists for Ledyard (3-13, 3-3). The Whalers are 0-13, 0-7. Putnam 3 Norwich Tech 1 PUTNAM — Gabby Simpson had nine kills and seven assists and the Clippers (5-7, 5-3 CSC East) held off a late rally to defeat the Warriors, 14-25, 25-19, 26-24, 14-25, 16-14 for their third win in a row. Anna Hammar had 18 kills and six blocks for Norwich Tech (8-5, 7-1). Windham Tech 3 Grasso Tech 0 WILLIMANTIC — Makayla Christian served up 11 points to go along with five kills and the Mighty Tigers won their fourth straight match, 25-18, 25-16, 18-25, 25-23. Page 2 of 2 - Valeria Hernandez added 10 assists, eight service points and five kills for Windham Tech (11-5, 6-2 CSC East). Grasso Tech dropped to 3-13 overall, 1-8 in the division. Wheeler 3 DANIELSON — The Lions (7-9) swept the Eagles, 25-21, 25-12, 25-22 to move closer to .500. Monet Smith had eight kills for Ellis Tech (2-12). FIELD HOCKEY Woodstock 4 Fitch-Ledyard 1 GROTON — Mikayla Jones scored twice and the Centaurs topped the Falcons for their third straight win. Hannah Chubbock and Mackenzie Stewart also scored for Woodstock Academy (6-6, 6-5 ECC). Sophie Reilly scored for Fitch-Ledyard (0-11, 0-9). Waterford 2 Windham 0 WILLIMANTIC — Hannah Sugrue scored two goals, both assisted by Cassidy Susi, and the Lancers broke a six-game losing streak with the win. Waterford improved to 3-8-1, 3-7-1 ECC. The Whippets are 0-13, 0-10. MEN’S SOCCER NFA grad named top NECC rookie ATTLEBORO, Mass. — Mitchell College freshman and Norwich Free Academy alum Andris Vital was named the New England Collegiate Conference Rookie of the Week, the league announced Monday. Vital had two goals in a 7-0 win over Becker College on Saturday, scoring the first and last goal of the game for the Mariners. It was the first multi-goal game of Vital’s collegiate career and he is currently third on the team in scoring with 5 goals for 10 points. By The Bulletin
